notes: The Anaheim Ducks placed F Robby Fabbri on Injured Reserve on Thursday (Feb. 27).
Foligno did not return to Thursday's (Feb. 27) game versus the Golden Knights.
Wilson did not play in Thursday's (Feb. 27) clash against the Blues.
Nurse did not play in Thursday's (Feb. 27) game against the Panthers.
Sillinger suffered an upper body injury and did not return to Thursday's (Feb. 27) game against the Red Wings.
Poitras did not return to Thursday's (Feb. 27) game versus the Islanders.
Zucker is OUT for Thursday's (Feb. 27) matchup against the Hurricanes, as per Lance Lysowski of The Buffalo News.
Hathaway did not return to Thursday's (Feb. 27) clash against the Penguins after sustaining an undisclosed injury, per Flyers GM Daniel Briere.
The Utah Hockey Club listed Carcone as OUT for Thursday's (Feb. 27) game against the Wild.
Thrun did not return to Thursday's (Feb. 27) game against the Canadiens, per Sheng Peng of San Jose Hockey Now..
Doughty did not play in Wednesday's (Feb. 26) game versus the Canucks.
The Pittsburgh Penguins placed F Michael Bunting on injured reserve on Thursday (Feb. 27).
Kleven did not return to Wednesday's (Feb. 26) game versus the Jets.
Nylander was bothered by an undisclosed injury that kept him off the ice during overtime in Tuesday's (Feb. 25) victory over the Bruins, per David Alter of The Hockey News.
Miller did not return to Tuesday's (Feb. 25) game versus the Islanders.
The Predators listed Jankowski as OUT for Thursday's (Feb. 27) game against Winnipeg.
The Minnesota Wild placed F Joel Eriksson Ek on Injured Reserve on Tuesday (Feb. 25).
Frederic is considered week-to-week due to a lower-body injury, according to Chris Johnston of The Athletic reports Thursday (Feb. 27).
Josi will not be available to face Winnipeg on Thursday (Feb. 27), as per Brooks Bratten of the Predators' official site.
The New York Rangers placed D Adam Fox on injured reserve on Wednesday (Feb. 26).
Tanev isn't expected to play Friday (Feb. 28) against the Rangers, but he might not be out for long, per David Alter of The Hockey News on Wednesday (Feb. 26).
Dach will not play against San Jose on Thursday (Feb. 27), as per Renaud Lavoie of TVA.
Rasmussen will remain out of the lineup versus Columbus on Thursday (Feb. 27), as per Ansar Khan of MLive.com.
The New York Islanders placed F Matt Martin on the Injured Reserve on Monday (Feb. 24).
Bichsel is in concussion protocol and will be sidelined for at least five to six days, according to Sean Shapiro of DLLS Sports on Tuesday (Feb. 25).
Kreider did not play in Tuesday's (Feb. 25) game versus the Islanders.
Tkachuk did not play in Wednesday's (Feb. 26) game against the Jets.
Copp will miss the remainder of the 2024-25 campaign after undergoing surgery Tuesday (Feb. 25) to repair a torn pectoral tendon.
The Ducks listed Gibson as OUT for Thursday's (Feb. 27) game against the Canucks.
Tkachuk did not play in Thursday's (Feb. 27) contest against the Oilers.
Labanc was placed on injured reserve after undergoing shoulder surgery Friday (Feb. 21) and will miss the rest of the season.
Pacioretty looked good during Wednesday's (Feb.26) practice and is likely to return Friday (Feb. 28) versus the Rangers, according to Mark Masters of TSN.
The Vancouver Canucks placed D Noah Juulsen on Injured Reserve on Saturday (Feb. 22).
The Boston Bruins placed D Charlie McAvoy on Injured Reserve on Saturday (Feb. 23).
Pezzetta did not play in Thursday's (Feb. 27) game against the Sharks.
Theodore is week-to-week after he was injured early in the second period versus Sweden on Wednesday (Feb. 12), per Danny Webster of the Las Vegas Review-Journal.
The Vancouver Canucks placed G Thatcher Demko on the Injured Reserve.
The Nashville Predators placed F Zachary L'Heureux on injured reserve on Friday (Feb. 21) and is week-to-week.
The Nashville Predators placed D Adam Wilsby on injured reserve on Friday (Feb. 21) and will miss the remainder of the season.
The Chicago Blackhawks placed F Jason Dickinson on Injured Reserved on Saturday (Feb. 22).
Manson did not play in Wednesday's (Feb. 26) game against the Devils.
Pinto did not play in Wednesday's (Feb. 26) game against the Jets.
The Devils announced on Wednesday (Feb. 18) that Siegenthaler underwent a lower-body procedure during the break for the 4 Nations Face-Off and will be re-evaluated in 2-3 weeks.
Norris did not play in Wednesday's (Feb. 26) game against the Jets.
The New York Rangers placed F Adam Edstrom on injured reserve on Tuesday (Feb. 4).
Barzal was transferred to long-term injured reserve Wednesday (Feb. 26), according to Stefen Rosner of NHL.com.
Kovalenko could return during the middle of the Sharks' seven game road trip, per Max Miller of NHL.com.
Head coach Scott Arniel said Monday that Barron (upper body) is close to returning to game action, Mitchell Clinton of the Jets' official site reports.
The Dallas Stars placed D Nils Lundkvist on Long Term Injured Reserve on Saturday (Feb. 1).
Heiskanen underwent successful knee surgery in New York on Tuesday (Feb. 4) and is being labeled month-to-month, per Stars radio analyst Bruce LeVine.
The Canadiens announced on Wednesday (Jan. 29) that Guhle sustained a lacerated quadricep muscle and is out indefinitely.
Kaprizov remains on Long-term Injured Reserve and is slated to be out longer than originally expected, GM Bill Guerin said Friday (Feb. 21), per NHL.com.
The Islanders reported on Saturday (Feb. 1) that Hogberg will have his status be assessed after the 4 Nations Face-Off, according to Rachel Luscher of the Islanders' official site.
The Ottawa Senators placed F Nick Cousins on the Injured Reserve.
The Sharks reported on Tuesday (Feb. 18) that Rutta is healing slower than anticipated and is not expected to be back soon, per Max Miller of NHL.com.
The Vegas Golden Knights placed F William Karlsson on long-term injured reserve on Thursday (Feb. 6).
The New Jersey Devils placed G Jacob Markstrom on injured reserve on Tuesday (Feb. 18).
Dewar remains on Injured Reserve for Tuesday's (Feb. 25) tilt with Boston, Mark Masters of TSN.
Schwindt won't accompany the Golden Knights on their upcoming four-game road trip, as per Jesse Granger of The Athletic Thursday (Jan. 30).
The Blue Jackets announced on Saturday (Jan. 25) that Monahan is expected to be out until mid-March after recently suffering a setback in his recovery, per Aaron Portzline of The Athletic.
The Ottawa Senators placed D Jacob Bernard-Docker on long-term injured reserve on Sunday (Feb. 2).
Hurricanes' head coach Rod Brind'Amour said on Friday (Jan. 24) that Carrier has undergone surgery and is facing a long-term absence, per Chip Alexander of The Raleigh News & Observer.
The Seattle Kraken placed F Yanni Gourde on long-term injured reserve on Friday (Feb. 21).

The Hockey Club reported on Tuesday (Feb. 18) that Bortuzzo remains on injured reserve and won't return to the lineup when play resumes after the 4 Nations Face-Off, per Brogan Houston of Deseret News Sports.
The Red Wings reported on Wednesday (Jan. 29) that Petry will not travel with the team for their upcoming four-game road trip, per Ansar Khan of MLive.com.
The Predators announced on Tuesday (Feb. 18) that Lauzon will miss 4-6 months with a lower-body injury.
The Ducks announced on Tuesday (Jan. 21) that McGinn had surgery to reconstruct his ACL and will be sidelined for 7-9 months.
Regula was never taken off the season-opening injured reserve despite being waived by Boston and claimed by Edmonton on Wednesday (Dec. 11), per Daniel Nugent-Bowman of The Athletic.
The New York Islanders placed G Semyon Varlamov on long-term injured reserve on Thursday (Dec. 19) and is out indefinitely.
Seguin remains on Long-term Injured Reserve but has started skating back in Texas, according to Sean Shapiro of DLLS Sports.
The Blue Jackets announced on Saturday (Jan. 18) that Chinakhov is still a few weeks away from a return, per Mark Scheig of The Hockey Writers.
The Flames announced that Kirkland underwent successful ACL surgery on Wednesday (Dec. 4) and he will be out for the remainder of the season.
The Maple Leafs reported on Saturday (Feb. 1) that Hakanpaa won't participate in the upcoming 4 Nations Face-Off.
Lindholm underwent surgery for a fractured patella and is likely out for the season, Conor Ryan of The Boston Globe reports.
The Capitals announced that Milano took part in Wednesday's (Jan. 15) practice, though he was wearing a non-contact jersey, per Tom Gulitti of NHL.com.
The Flames announced that Mantha will require surgery on his ACL on Thursday (Nov. 14) and will miss the remainder of the 2024-25 season.
The Islanders reported on Tuesday (Jan. 21) that Reilly has been skating and working out and intends to return by the end of the season.

Gudbranson skated Saturday (Feb. 22) for the first time since undergoing shoulder surgery in mid-October but could still be a month away from returning to action, according to Mark Scheig of The Hockey Writers.
The Vegas Golden Knights placed D Lukas Cormier on injured reserve non-roster list on Tuesday (Oct. 8).
The Colorado Avalanche placed D Tucker Poolman on long-term injured reserve. He didn't play in 2023-24 due to migraines and won't be available for the 2024-25 campaign either.
The Philadelphia Flyers placed D Ryan Ellis on injured reserve on Monday (Oct. 7).
The Maple Leafs announced on Tuesday (Jan. 14) that Jarnkrok will be re-evaluated in two weeks to determine a clearer recovery timeline, per David Alter of The Hockey News.

Grosenick underwent successful surgery on Wednesday (Oct. 2) to repair a torn ACL in his right knee and will not play this season. He is expected to make a full recovery and be ready for the start of the 2025-26 season.
The Nashville Predators placed F Austin Roest on injured reserve non-roster list on Sunday (Sept. 29).
The Sharks announced on Friday (Nov. 1) that Couture has not resumed skating and remains without a timeline to return, per Sheng Peng of San Jose Hockey.
Kane remains on Long-term Injured Reserve but started skating Thursday (Feb. 21), according to Jason Gregor of Sports 1440 Edmonton.

The Capitals said on Wednesday (Sept. 18) that Oshie will be put on long-term injured reserve due to a chronic back injury which is expected to cost him the entire 2024-25 campaign, per Tom Gulitti of NHL.com.
The St. Louis Blues placed D Torey Krug on long-term injured reserve on Tuesday (Oct. 8).
The Hurricanes announced on Wednesday (Oct. 9) that Fast is out for the 2024-2025 season as he recovers from neck surgery.
Blackhawks' GM Kyle Davidson said on Monday (Jan. 27) that he's hopeful that Brossoit will be able to return at some point this season, per Charlie Roumeliotis of WGN Radio.
The Washington Capitals placed F Nicklas Backstrom on long-term injured reserve.
Avalanche head coach Jared Bednar said on Thursday (Jan. 2) that Landeskog remains without a timetable to return, per Corey Masisak of The Denver Post.
